availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Stoll, Jr. (Lexington, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of George W. Stoll, Sr., and Mary Jane Stoll. Married to Julia H. Stoll. Father of Hamilton Stoll. Student in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Lexington, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington District 2, p. 199B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 569.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 2, p. 204A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 1, p. 274D.
Find A Grave, “George W Stoll (1841-1914),” Memorial #98418314, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98418314/george-w-stoll (accessed June 4, 2017).
